title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

Each criterion is achieved independently.
descriptions:
Response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.

Task A: Identify ONE way that technological changes facilitated trade in the Indian Ocean in the period 1200–1450.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· The development of the compass facilitated trade in the Indian Ocean.

· The increasing use of the astrolabe facilitated trade in the Indian Ocean.

· Larger ships and improved ship designs helped increase Indian Ocean trade

· Better ships allowed merchants to carry larger amounts of luxury goods and reduce shipwrecks.

Task B: Explain ONE way that trade in the Indian Ocean in the period 1200–1450 led to political change.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· Indian Ocean trade influenced the development of states in the period 1200–1450 because it allowed those states to grow wealthier and expand in some cases.

· State development was influenced by Indian Ocean trade because new trading cities emerged.

· States such as Srivijaya and Egypt were able to expand their wealth and influence through Indian Ocean trade.

Task C: Explain ONE way that trade in the Indian Ocean in the period 1200–1450 led to cultural change.

Some examples that would earn credit include:

· Trade in the Indian Ocean influenced cultural change in the period 1200–1450 because indigenous communities’ cultural traditions were often influenced by the cultural traditions of diasporic merchant communities.

· Muslim merchant communities established themselves in southern India and spread Islam.

· The Arabic and Persian languages spread with increased trade

· Commercial contacts in the Indian Ocean region helped spread Chinese methods of shipbuilding and design among Indian Ocean merchants.
Response accomplishes any one of the tasks set by the question.
Response accomplishes any two of the tasks set by the question.
Response accomplishes all three of the tasks set by the question.
